Tweet: We are big fans of our friends over at @KSRO who pulled together some great round the clock coverage during this fire and during 2017.

We just noticed that the @CountyofSonoma map which has been an *incredible* resource during the #kincadefire, now includes evacuation information extending into Lake and Napa counties. Very thankful for the preparedness by the county this time around.https://sonomacounty.maps.arcgis.com/apps/webappviewer/index.html?id=2cb4401e1fc0494dbf9d9e22aa794617 …
There are isolated reports of power lines around the #kincadefire falling due to weakened trees. If you see power lines falling, assume they are hot and call 911 immediately.

There are some unemployment benefits available through the state for workers unable to work due to the #kincadefire No federal assistance is available at the moment https://edd.ca.gov/about_edd/disaster_related_services.htm …
Indeed! We believe both of them to be the same model, but it's not clear if either or both live in San Bernadino. We definitely saw 914 fly in this morning from Southern California though
I believe that's may be TNKR914 which we're happy to have visiting us up here for the #kincadefire (Currently dropping over Geyserville)
@CALFIRE_PIO Just a heads up, the IEP for today still mislabels Windsor and Healdsburg on the travel map (p44). Windsor is the one to the south.
Great catch on the cams :)
This looks like TNKR911 which is from southern California and has already headed back to Sacramento to get more flame retardant Nice video! Stay safe out there.
The drop in winds means smoke is not clearing out of the #kincadefire area and surrounding parts of the 101 corridor. Please stay inside as much as is possible.
Air tankers are moving in to the #kincadefire area to take advantage of decreased winds today.

Plans for repopulating evacuated areas will be forthcoming but these mandatory #kincadefire evacuation areas are _still_ under evacuation. Text your zip code to 888-777 in order to get updates for when you can come home
I had not noticed that, guessing @CAL_FIRE didn't have much sleep last night :)
Sonoma county learned some painful lessons in 2017 which has resulted in stellar public safety preparedness

We're not convinced that @kentphotos has had any sleep this weekend, but we really appreciate his journalism work out there.

For our friends near the #GlenCoveFire that are scared or concerned. You'll be okay, but please sign up for official alerts by texting your zip code to 888-777 for official govt updates.

We have used "no orders _yet_" a lot of the past couple days. Stay safe out there
I'm sure they'll be sent north soon. We saw them out there yesterday, always welcome to visit :)

During the 2017 fires cell service was severely degraded due to fires consuming the towers. There is risk of this happening, which is why the sheriff's vehicles are equipped with these special hi/lo sirenshttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NQJGUynM-6w …
Those areas in west county are still under an evacuation warning rather than a mandatory order like that for Healdsburg and Windsor

Evacuation centers are: * Santa Rosa Vets Hall * Petaluma Vets Hall * Petaluma Fairgrounds The Sonoma County Fairgrounds are open to large animals only. If you can’t evacuate due to medical conditions or advanced age, call 911 for help #kincadefire
The are forecasted out of the northeast blowing south southwest.
Prior to the Tubbs Fire in 2017 we didn't expect that fires would jump 101. It's now part of the worst-case scenarios, and the forecasted winds this evening definitely point towards "worst-case."
If you are having anxiety or emotional trouble with the #KincadeFire and need to talk with someone, you can call the Disaster Distress Helpline at: 800-985-5990

There are no evacuation orders or warnings for any part of Santa Rosa city limits. It's probably better to stay put and sign up for Nixle by texting your zip to 888-777 in case this changes.
Not quite, they're evacuating 50k people ahead of winds which look very similar to those in October 2017 which started the Tubbs, Nuns, Atlas, and Redwood fires.
That looks like @GlobalSuperTank which refuels at MCC along with a number of the other tankers assigned to the #KincadeFire
Healdsburg and Windsor are both under mandatory evacuation orders. The town of Sonoma is about 30mi south east and in no danger from the Kincade fire.
